title: Improve logging in GetBlockFromPeersTask

labels.name: P2
labels.description: High (ex: Degrading performance issues, unexpected behavior of core features (DevP2P, syncing, etc))

body:
### Description
Two canary nodes on different networks (rinkeby, mainnet) both became "stuck" at a particular block.  Logs did not indicate the reason for the failure, but both nodes had a full complement of peers and were unable to download the correct block, and effectively halted.

In both cases, the failures were transient and the nodes were able to proceed normally after a restart.  One node restarted with a required-block parameter, but the other a simple restart was able to remedy.

Discussion led us to believe there is a failure happening in the async networking code that is not getting logged; logging the exception would likely reveal the true source of the problem.


### Acceptance Criteria
* add exceptional completion error logging in DownloadBlockFromPeersTask

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: 21.10.0-RC4
* Java version: openjdk 11.0.11 2021-04-20 LTS

### Additional Information
TeamRevenant - timebox investigation into this: half a day. Can we reproduce it.
Mainnet Block Number is 13550420, Block Hash 0x0f0a2dd944d2c5afda4d136a66941aaf72bef05d57d41bdfbb970c583e6b50a7
